intro: Conostylis stylidioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. Conostylis stylidioides is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of local ecosystems.
